entity.name: tboy1337
entity.description:
Independent software developer passionate about code quality tools and Windows batch script automation. I believe even legacy technologies like batch files deserve professional-grade tooling.

Blinter was born from the frustration of debugging complex batch scripts without proper linting support. It's now a comprehensive static analysis tool with 159 rules across 5 severity levels, helping developers write safer and more maintainable batch files.

I'm committed to keeping Blinter free and open source under the AGPL-3.0 license, ensuring it remains accessible to everyone while protecting the community's contributions.

projects.name: Blinter
projects.description:
Blinter is a professional-grade linter for Windows batch files (.bat and .cmd). It provides comprehensive static analysis to identify syntax errors, security vulnerabilities, performance issues, and style problems.

Key Features:
• 159 built-in rules across 5 severity levels (Error, Warning, Style, Security, Performance)
• Advanced variable tracking and expansion validation
• Security scanning for command injection, path traversal, and unsafe operations
• Performance optimization suggestions
• Thread-safe design for concurrent processing
• Robust encoding detection (UTF-8, UTF-16, Latin-1, and more)
• Large file handling (10MB+)
• CLI and programmatic Python API
• Inline suppression comments for fine-grained control
• Configuration file support

Even in 2025, batch files are still widely used for system administration, automation, CI/CD pipelines, and legacy systems. Blinter fills a critical gap by providing modern tooling for this often-overlooked technology.

The project is actively maintained with comprehensive test coverage (>90%), full type annotations, and professional development practices.

channels.description: Contact me via email to discuss funding arrangements. I can accept bank transfers and various payment methods.

plans.name: Maintenance & Bug Fixes
plans.description:
This plan covers ongoing maintenance and stability improvements:

• Regular bug fixes and issue triage
• Dependency updates and security patches
• Test suite maintenance and expansion
• Community support and issue responses
• Minor feature improvements and rule additions
• Documentation updates
• Compatibility testing with new Python versions

This ensures Blinter remains reliable, secure, and compatible with evolving systems.

plans.name: Active Development
plans.description:
Enables significant feature development and ecosystem expansion:

• New linting rules and advanced analysis (cross-script analysis, call graphs)
• Major features: editor extensions, GUI interface
• Performance optimization and CI/CD platform integrations
• Comprehensive documentation and community engagement
• AI-assisted batch script analysis research

Allows dedicated time for ambitious improvements that enhance Blinter's capabilities and reach.

plans.name: One-Time Goodwill Support
plans.description:
A flexible support option for anyone who wants to contribute to Blinter's development without ongoing commitment.

Any amount is appreciated and helps cover:
• Development time and effort
• Infrastructure and tooling costs
• Documentation and learning resources
• General project sustainability

This is perfect for users who have benefited from Blinter and want to show their appreciation.

history.description: Initial development year. Applied to FLOSS/fund and established funding.json manifest. Actively seeking sustainable funding to dedicate more time to development.
